pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:0.2_0: The account of the nun Analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:0.5_0: The training rule on throwing out one who has thrown out,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.12_0: Because of this, people visited Bhaddā Kāpilānī first and then Thullanandā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.14_0: “These ones, who are supposedly contented and have few desires, who are supposedly secluded and not socializing, are always persuading and convincing people.” And in anger she threw Bhaddā Kāpilānī out of that dwelling place.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.15_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized Thullanandā,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.16_0: “How could Venerable Thullanandā give a dwelling place to Venerable Bhaddā Kāpilānī and then throw her out in anger?” ...
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.17_0: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.20_0: “... How could the nun Thullanandā do this?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.21_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.22_0: the Buddha said, “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.23.1_0: ‘If a nun gives a dwelling place to a nun, and then, in anger, throws her out or has her thrown out, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.2_0: At that time Bhaddā Kāpilānī had entered the rainy-season residence at Sāketa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.3_0: But because she was disturbed by a certain matter, she sent a message to the nun Thullanandā:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.4_0: “If you would give me a dwelling place, I would come to Sāvatthī.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.7_0: Bhaddā Kāpilānī then traveled from Sāketa to Sāvatthī,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.8_0: and Thullanandā gave her a dwelling place.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:1.9_0: At that time Thullanandā was a learned reciter, and she was confident and skilled at giving teachings.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.1.12_0: And I didn’t want my mind.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.1.14_0: if she takes hold of her in a room and throws her out to the porch, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.1.15_0: If she takes hold of her on the porch and throws her outside, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.1.16_0: Even if he makes him go through many doors with a single effort, he commits one offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.1.18_0: if she asks another, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.1.19_0: If she only asks once, then even if the other makes her go through many doors, she commits one offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.1.4_0: ... The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.1.8_0: one with a door is what is meant.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.10_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.11_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she perceives them as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.1_0: If the other person is fully ordained, and she perceives her as such, and she gives her a dwelling place, and she then throws her out in anger or has her thrown out, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.2_0: If the other person is fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, and she gives her a dwelling place, and she then throws her out in anger or has her thrown out, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.3_0: If the other person is fully ordained, but she does not perceive her as such, and she gives her a dwelling place, and she then throws her out in anger or has her thrown out, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.4_0: If she throws out one of her requisites from that place, or she has it thrown out, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.5_0: If she throws her out or has her thrown out from a dwelling place without a door, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.6_0: If she throws out one of her requisites from that place, or she has it thrown out, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.7_0: If he throws out one who is not fully ordained, or has him thrown out, from a dwelling place without a door, or he has him thrown out, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.8_0: If she throws out one of her requisites from that place, or she has it thrown out, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.2.9_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she perceives them as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.3.11_0: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.3.12_0: The fifth rule, the training rule on fifth, is finished.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.3.2_0: if she throws out, or has thrown out, one who is shameless;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.3.3_0: if she throws out the requisites belonging to such a person, or has them thrown out;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.3.4_0: if she throws out, or has thrown out, one who is insane;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.3.5_0: if she throws out the requisites belonging to such a person, or has them thrown out;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.3.6_0: if she throws out, or has thrown out, one who is quarrelsome and argumentative, and who creates legal issues in the Sangha;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.3.7_0: if she throws out the requisites belonging to such a person, or has them thrown out;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.3.8_0: if she throws out, or has thrown out, a pupil or student who is not conducting herself properly;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc35:2.3.9_0: if she throws out the requisites belonging to such a person, or has them thrown out;
